results.title: Population and the American future
results.creator_credit: John Martin, Craig Fisher and Fisher Film Group
results.brief_description: The official report of the National Commission on Population and the American future, which was created by Congress at the request of President Nixon. Summarises the effects of increased population growth, with conclusions and recommendation on how to stop this growth. One of the recommendations made by the Report was “to bring the working poor and those who cannot find work, into the mainstream of the economic society” - interesting projections into the future (circa 1973)!

results.title: Populate or perish
results.brief_description: Explores Australia’s population debate showing how after 50 years of continuous growth, new arguments about limiting Australia’s population are emerging. This program examines the post-war era when the cry to “Populate or perish” fostered Government sponsored immigration shemes, provided the applicants were white. It traces the gradual evolution of Australia as a multicultural society, primarily concentrated on the east coast.

results.title: Popular psychology
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How much faith should one put in popular psychology? When psychological theories are all around, how is the lay person to keep proper perspectives? The film centers the question around two women, Barbara and Jane. Barbara is regarded by Jane as indulging in the psychology fad, looking for problems in her husband and child to practise her do-it-yourself analysis. But, wonders Jane, is a little psychology better than none at all? The question is left open for discussion.

results.title: Popeye the sailor
results.brief_description: A compilation of five animated cartoons featuring that famous spinach-eating hero Popeye the Sailor, along with the usual co-stars, his dearly beloved Olive Oyl, Bluto the interfering bully and Popeye’s mischievous young nephews. Interesting to note that in “Popeye meets Ali Baba’s forty thieves” there is a mix of real life background with the animation which apparently was often a feature of the very early Popeye cartoons. Good family entertainment.

results.title: Popeye
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Robert Evans and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The comic strip and animated sailor hero with a thing for spinach comes to life in this meticulous live action kids film. Director Robert Altman traces the origins of Popeye, his battle against arch-rival Bluto and his budding romance with Olive Oyl. Cast includes Robin Williams, Shelley Duvall, Ray Walston, Paul L. Smith, Paul Dooley.

results.title: Pop movie. Part 2
results.brief_description: Fremont High School in Elizabeth Park South Australia is a school that is becoming famous for its musical productions. A group of students who are involved in the production of a Rock Musical from casting to preparation of a backdrop which depicts the area in which they live show the fun and sharing that occurs during rehearsals for the show “Type Cast”. Students commence on the breaking down of class level barriers that normally exist in schools, on the ease of communicating with teachers as they learn about devising and producing a pop musical. Positive attitudes are fostered, about self and ability and all regard the experience as “great”!

results.title: Pop movie. Part 1
results.brief_description: A six part series offering an in-depth view of the rock music industry. To those who are fans or aspire to a career in music it is compulsory viewing; and for a more general audience it is an insight into the chaotic world of rock `n’ roll.
